Description: Rim sherd of East Greek Wild Goat Style pottery lekane with handle join at rim; white slip; interior, from top: added red band at top of wall; broken maeander frieze; frieze of multiple motifs, dotted maeander(?) chevrons, filled square; exterior: band on top of rim, cross-hatched square motif to left of handle stub, further motif under handle; below, frieze of various motifs. Coarse, worn.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 36, no. A. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.45)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: I.A.4 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
